1-2-2_passive.label: 1-2-2 Passive
1-2-2_passive.usage: Safe, structure-first. Great vs rush-heavy teams.

1-2-2_aggressive.label: 1-2-2 Aggressive
1-2-2_aggressive.usage: Higher pressure. Good when trailing or vs weak breakout teams.

2-3.usage: Neutral balance vs teams that attack through middle lane.

weak_side_lock.label: Weak Side Lock
weak_side_lock.usage: Top choice vs teams that use boards & reverse breakout.

1-2-2_red.label: 1-2-2 Red
1-2-2_red.usage: Best vs cycle-heavy teams and forecheck pressure teams.

1-2-2_blue.label: 1-2-2 Blue
1-2-2_blue.usage: More conservative. Good when protecting lead.

1-3-1.usage: Kills mid-lane rushes. Best vs elite speed (e.g., Larkin, McDavid).

1-4.usage: Full trap. Only activate when protecting a lead late.

defensive_pressure.protect_net: Low aggression, collapses inside. Good vs inside drives.
defensive_pressure.puck_side_attack: Pressures puck carrier. Use vs slow decision makers.
defensive_pressure.high_pressure: Dangerous if misused. Only when trailing or opponent is rattled.

defensive_strategy.collapsing: Best vs net-crash teams, inside attackers.
defensive_strategy.tight_point: Best vs teams that fire a ton of point shots (Seider, Josi).

control_breakout.blue_to_blue: Great for stretch plays and fast wingers.

quick_breakout.stay_wide: Opens lanes; good vs collapsing forechecks.
quick_breakout.leave_zone_early: High risk/reward. Only for top speed lines.
